title: César E. Chávez National Monument: Safety
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Safety            Safety       If you have a first-aid or medical situation at the monument, please contact the nearest park employee.   If the visitor center is closed, call 911 from the pay telephone (left of the visitor center entrance) or from your cell phone. The nearest emergency services are in the town of Tehachapi (11 miles east) or in the city of Bakersfield (35 miles west).   Weapons & Firearms: It is illegal to possess weapons (including, but not limited to, BB, pellet and paint guns, bow/arrow, slingshots, bear spray, and other compressed-gas irritant devices). No firearms, including concealed-carry, are allowed in the visitor center.
